alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 11:06AM EDT until June 19 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Lexington and Richland. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1106 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, West Columbia, Cayce, Forest Acres, St. Andrews, Five Points, SC State Fair Grounds, West Columbia Riverwalk, Olympia, Rosewood, Guignard Park and Cayce Riverwalk. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 near mile marker 3. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding will occur in the Five Points area extending downstream along Rocky Branch Creek. This includes Maxcy Gregg Park, areas of the USC campus along the creek, the intersection at Pickens and Blossom, the intersection at Whaley and Main and areas of the Olympia neighborhood along the creek.
